jparsec.ephem.probes

Class Spacecraft

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.ephem.probes.Spacecraft

  • public class Spacecraft
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides data for most of the space probes launched so far, as well as methods for ephemeris calculations. It is possible to calculate ephemeris and to obtain ecliptic coordinates of each one in the correct time span where the probe was active, being able to graphically recreate the whole history of space exploration. Of course, this is intended for educational purposes. These calculations require a set of orbital elements for each spacecraft at different times, which is available as a dependency for the JPARSEC library, usually named orbital_elements.jar.

    The orbital elements come from the JPL and are suitable for low precision ephemeris. For high precision ephemeris please use the JPL Horizons System.

    To use this class follow these simple steps: 

     // Search one probe.
 int probe = Probes.searchProbe("Galileo-10");
 
 // Modify the previously defined EphemerisElement to account for the algorithm
 // to apply, and for the selected probe.
 eph.TARGET_BODY = TARGET.NOT_A_PLANET;
 eph.ALGORITHM = EphemerisElement.ALGORITHM.PROBE;
 eph.ORBIT = (OrbitalElement) Probes.getProbeElement(probe);
 
 // Calc ephemeris refered to certain Time and Observer objects.
 EphemElement ephem = orbitEphemeris(time, observer, eph);
 
 // A simple alternative (but less efficient for subsequent calculations) using 
 // the main Ephem class is, in its full form:
 
 try
 {
                AstroDate astro = new AstroDate(1, AstroDate.JANUARY, 2001, 0, 0, 0);
                TimeElement time = new TimeElement(astro(), SCALE.TERRESTRIAL_TIME);
                ObserverElement observer = new ObserverElement.parseCity(City.findCity("Madrid"));
                EphemerisElement eph = new EphemerisElement(Target.NOT_A_PLANET, EphemerisElement.COORDINATES_TYPE.APPARENT,
                                EphemerisElement.EQUINOX_OF_DATE, EphemerisElement.TOPOCENTRIC, EphemerisElement.REDUCTION_METHOD.WILLIAMS_1994,
                                EphemerisElement.FRAME.ICRF, EphemerisElement.ALGORITHM.PROBE);
                eph.orbit = Probes.getOrbitalElementsOfMinorBody("Galileo-10");
                if (eph.orbit != null) {
                        String name = "Galileo";
                        EphemElement ephem = Ephem.getEphemeris(time, observer, eph, true);
                        ConsoleReport.basicReportToConsole(ephem, name);
                }
 } catch (JPARSECException ve)
 {
                ve.showException();
 }
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public static java.lang.String getName(int index)
                                throws JPARSECException
        Gets the name of the probe without it's current phase.
        Parameters:
        index - Probe index, from 0 to getNumberOfProbes()-1.
        Returns:
        Name of the probe. Empty string if the index is incorrect.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getIndex

        public static int getIndex(java.lang.String name)
                    throws JPARSECException
        Gets the index of a probe.
        Parameters:
        name - Probe name.
        Returns:
        Probe index of the first match, or -1 if no match in found.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getFullName

        public static java.lang.String getFullName(int index)
                                    throws JPARSECException
        Gets the full name of the probe. Format is "NAME-PHASE". Phase does not exist always.
        Parameters:
        index - Probe index, from 0 to getNumberOfProbes()-1.
        Returns:
        Name of the probe. Empty string if the index is incorrect.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getPhase

        public static java.lang.String getPhase(int index)
                                 throws JPARSECException
        Gets the phase of the probe. The phase changes when the reactor is on and the trajectory of the probe is modified. Sometimes could exist several phases active simultaneously. In that case, the last of them should be considered as the correct position of the probe.
        Parameters:
        index - Probe index, from 0 to getNumberOfProbes()-1.
        Returns:
        Phase of the probe. Empty string if no phase value exists, for example when the trajectory is Earth to target directly.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • searchProbe

        public static int searchProbe(java.lang.String name)
                       throws JPARSECException
        Searches for a probe name. Search for certain phase is possible by adding a "-" symbol and the phase numeric value. For example, "Cassini" will return the first match for Cassini space probe (typically phase 1), and "Cassini-6" will return the sixth (last) phase for this spacecraft.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the probe to search for.
        Returns:
        The ID index value for this probe. -1 if no match is found.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • searchProbe

        public static int searchProbe(java.lang.String name,
              double jd)
                       throws JPARSECException
        Searches for a probe name active in certain Julian day. Search for certain phase is possible by adding a "-" symbol and the phase numeric value, although it is not recommended nor necessary in this method.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the probe to search for.
        jd - Julian day.
        Returns:
        The ID value for this probe. -1 if no match is found.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the reference or applicable times are invalid.

      • getMaxPhase

        public static java.lang.String getMaxPhase(java.lang.String name)
                                    throws JPARSECException
        Gets the maximum value of the phase for certain probe.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the probe.
        Returns:
        The maximum phase. An empty string if no value exists.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

        public static boolean isTimeApplicable(OrbitalElement orbit,
                       double JD)
        Returns if the current time is valid for certain probe.
        Parameters:
        orbit - Orbit object for the probe.
        JD - Julian day.
        Returns:
        True is date is valid, false otherwise.

        public static boolean isTimeApplicable(TimeElement time,
                       ObserverElement obs,
                       EphemerisElement eph)
                                throws JPARSECException

        Parameters:
        time - Time object containing the date.
        obs - Observer object containing the observer position.

        Returns:
        True is date is valid, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the time or the index is invalid.

                                                    throws JPARSECException

        Parameters:
        name - Name, including phase.
        Returns:
        Orbital element set, or null if no match is found.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • horizons2JPARSEC

        public static java.lang.String horizons2JPARSEC(java.lang.String probe_name,
                                java.lang.String[] horizons,
                                double init_jd,
                                double end_jd)
                                         throws JPARSECException
        Transforms JPL Horizons format of orbital elements to JPARSEC format. Elements are supposed to be refered to J2000 epoch and calculated in certain date at 00:00 TT.

        Example of input format (taken from JPL Horizons system): 

         2453795.500000000 = A.D. 2006-Mar-01 00:00:00.0000 (CT)
 EC= 2.477738107218447E-01 QR= 1.012878320719386E+00 IN= 3.063985846769699E+00
 OM= 3.193402961435428E+02 W = 3.584021022460865E+02 Tp=  2453593.124935312662
 N = 6.307987654522806E-01 MA= 1.276579409631244E+02 TA= 1.462236568469655E+02
 A = 1.346507653092158E+00 AD= 1.680136985464930E+00 PR= 5.707049850388993E+02

        Output will be, if name set to MRO:

        MRO e 3.063986 319.340296 358.4021022 1.3465077 0.6307988 0.2477738 127.65794096 03/01.0/2006 2000 0 0

        Parameters:
        horizons - String array of length 5, in the previous format.
        probe_name - Name of the probe.
        init_jd - Initial jd (launch date or after orbit correction).
        end_jd - Final jd (orbit insertion or before orbit correction).
        Returns:
        JPARSEC format.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If something goes wrong.

      • horizons2OrbitalElement

        public static OrbitalElement horizons2OrbitalElement(java.lang.String probe_name,
                                     java.lang.String[] horizons,
                                     double init_jd,
                                     double end_jd)
                                              throws JPARSECException
        Transforms JPL Horizons format of orbital elements to an OrbitalElement object.

        Example of input format (taken from JPL Horizons system): 

         2453795.500000000 = A.D. 2006-Mar-01 00:00:00.0000 (CT)
 EC= 2.477738107218447E-01 QR= 1.012878320719386E+00 IN= 3.063985846769699E+00
 OM= 3.193402961435428E+02 W = 3.584021022460865E+02 Tp=  2453593.124935312662
 N = 6.307987654522806E-01 MA= 1.276579409631244E+02 TA= 1.462236568469655E+02
 A = 1.346507653092158E+00 AD= 1.680136985464930E+00 PR= 5.707049850388993E+02
        Parameters:
        horizons - String array of length 5, in the previous format.
        probe_name - Name of the probe.
        init_jd - Initial jd (launch date or after orbit correction).
        end_jd - Final jd (orbit insertion or before orbit correction).
        Returns:
        OrbitalElement object.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If something goes wrong.

      • orbitalElement2JPARSEC

        public static java.lang.String orbitalElement2JPARSEC(OrbitalElement orbit)
                                               throws JPARSECException
        Transforms an orbital element set to JPARSEC format of probes. The invert transformation is provided by ReadFile.parseProbe(String).

        Parameters:
        orbit - OrbitalElement set.
        Returns:
        JPARSEC format.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If something goes wrong.

      • orbitEphemeris

        public static EphemElement orbitEphemeris(TimeElement time,
                          ObserverElement obs,
                          EphemerisElement eph)
                                   throws JPARSECException
        Calculates probes positions, providing full data. This method uses orbital elements.

        The orbital element is automatically obtained by this method if the input orbital element set in the ephemeris object is null, and its target body number is the desired probe. In this case the target can be set to any phase of that probe, and if the probe has an active phase in the given calculation time, then the adequate phase will be automatically taken instead of the input one.

        Parameters:
        time - Time object containing the date.
        obs - Observer object containing the observer position.
        eph - Ephemeris object with the target and ephemeris properties.
        Returns:
        Ephem object containing ephemeris data. Rise, set, transit times and maximum elevation fields are not computed in this method, use Ephem class for that.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the calculation fails.

      • obtainPosition

        public static double[] obtainPosition(TimeElement time,
                      ObserverElement obs,
                      EphemerisElement eph)
                               throws JPARSECException
        Obtain heliocentric mean rectangular coordinates of a probe.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object containing the date.
        obs - Observer object containing the observer position.
        eph - Ephemeris object with the orbital element set included, and ephemeris properties.
        Returns:
        Array with positions and velocities.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the calculation fails.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        For unit testing only.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
